label: (official u-rate increase or decrease) Jemila lost her job and begins looking for a new one.
(official u-rate increase or decrease) West, a steelworker who has been out of work since his mill closed last year, becomes discouraged and gives up looking for work.

(official u-rate increase or decrease) Paul, the sole earner in his family of 5, just lost his \$100,000 job as a research scientist; and he takes a part-time job at McDonald's until he can find another job in his field.
(Frictional (or Structural), increase or decrease) The govt eliminates the minimum wage.
(Frictional (or Structural), increase or decrease) The govt increases unemployment insurance benefits.
(Frictional (or Structural), increase or decrease) A new law bans labor unions.
